q: It's very strange that the people you love are often the people you're most cruel to.
h:
“It's very strange that the people you love are often the people you're most cruel to.” —
Kenneth Branagh

q: Every time we liberate a woman, we liberate a man.
h:
“Every time we liberate a woman, we liberate a man. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: Life is filled with secrets. You can't learn them all at once.
h:
“Life is filled with secrets. You can't learn them all at once.” —
Dan Brown

q: We cannot change anything unless we accept it.
h:
“We cannot change anything unless we accept it.” —
Carl Jung

q: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
h:
“Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes. ” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Go as far as you can see and you will see further.
h:
“Go as far as you can see and you will see further. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: To plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow.
h:
“To plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow. ” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Saying nothing sometimes says the most.
h:
“Saying nothing sometimes says the most.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: The temptation to give up is strongest just before victory.
h:
“The temptation to give up is strongest just before victory.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.
h:
“Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Show me a hero, and I'll write you a tragedy.
h:
“Show me a hero, and I'll write you a tragedy.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.
h:
“Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.
h:
“A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise. ” —
Buddha

q: Even the smallest person can change the course of the future.
h:
“Even the smallest person can change the course of the future.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
h:
“You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.” —
A.A. Milne

q: Paths are made by walking.
h:
“Paths are made by walking.” —
Franz Kafka

q: When you want something in life, you just gotta reach out and grab it.
h:
“When you want something in life, you just gotta reach out and grab it.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.
h:
“The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: You must welcome change as the rule but not as your ruler.
h:
“You must welcome change as the rule but not as your ruler. ” —
Denis Waitley

q: Words are the clothing of our thoughts.
h:
“Words are the clothing of our thoughts.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
h:
“The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.” —
Alan Watts

q: To get angry is like to revenge yourself for the guilt of others.
h:
“To get angry is like to revenge yourself for the guilt of others.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: The purpose of life is the expansion of happiness.
h:
“The purpose of life is the expansion of happiness.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: The most efficient way of rendering the poor harmless is to teach them to want to imitate the rich.
h:
“The most efficient way of rendering the poor harmless is to teach them to want to imitate the rich.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.
h:
“Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: The content of your character is your choice. Day by day, what you choose, what you think and what you do is who you become.
h:
“The content of your character is your choice. Day by day, what you choose, what you think and what you do is who you become.” —
Heraclitus

q: Don't let someone elses. opinion become your reality.
h:
“Don't let someone elses. opinion become your reality.” —
Les Brown

q: Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.
h:
“Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.” —
Sun Tzu

q: When you're the only sane person, you look like the only insane person.
h:
“When you're the only sane person, you look like the only insane person.” —
Criss Jami

q: Our life is what our thoughts make it. A man will find that as he alters his thoughts toward things and other people, things and other people will alter towards him.
h:
“Our life is what our thoughts make it. A man will find that as he alters his thoughts toward things and other people, things and other people will alter towards him.” —
James Allen

q: Inspire yourself to be great. Being good isn't good enough.
h:
“Inspire yourself to be great. Being good isn't good enough.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: It is not fair to ask of others what you are not willing to do yourself.
h:
“It is not fair to ask of others what you are not willing to do yourself.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Your chances of success in any undertaking can always be measured by your belief in yourself.
h:
“Your chances of success in any undertaking can always be measured by your belief in yourself.” —
Robert Collier

q: The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something.
h:
“The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something.” —
Barack Obama

q: In the beginner's mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert's mind there are few.
h:
“In the beginner's mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert's mind there are few.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: When you know what you want, and you want it bad enough, you will find a way to get it.
h:
“When you know what you want, and you want it bad enough, you will find a way to get it.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Don't seek, don't avoid, don't expect. Take what comes and be happy.
h:
“Don't seek, don't avoid, don't expect. Take what comes and be happy.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Enthusiasm makes up for a host of deficiencies.
h:
“Enthusiasm makes up for a host of deficiencies.” —
Barack Obama

q: Every man gotta right to decide his own destiny.
h:
“Every man gotta right to decide his own destiny.” —
Bob Marley

q: I am not absentminded. It is the presence of mind that makes me unaware of everything else.
h:
“I am not absentminded. It is the presence of mind that makes me unaware of everything else.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: The greatest of empires, is the empire over one's self.
h:
“The greatest of empires, is the empire over one's self.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: The goal is not to show how great you are to others, but how vulnerable you are to yourself.
h:
“The goal is not to show how great you are to others, but how vulnerable you are to yourself.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: We must learn to live together as brothers or perish together as fools.
h:
“We must learn to live together as brothers or perish together as fools.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Talk does not cook rice.
h:
“Talk does not cook rice.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it's all an experience.
h:
“Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it's all an experience.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Every strike brings me closer to the next home run.
h:
“Every strike brings me closer to the next home run. ” —
Babe Ruth

q: A heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.
h:
“A heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.” —
Judy Garland

q: Do not believe that you will reach your destination without leaving the shore.
h:
“Do not believe that you will reach your destination without leaving the shore. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: You can do two things at once, but you can't focus effectively on two things at once.
h:
“You can do two things at once, but you can't focus effectively on two things at once.” —
Gary Keller

q: I live by letting things happen.
h:
“I live by letting things happen.” —
Dogen
